item.title: 4 levels of protein structure
item.description: There are four levels of protein structure: primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary. Primary Structure. # A proteinâ€™s primary structure is the unique sequence of amino acids in each polypeptide chain that makes up the protein. Reference: # 3.9: Proteins - Protein Structure Thanks! # Really appreciate your time for reading my blog, and bless you enjoy your day!
